ISSUE.TITLE: getInstalledPackageVersion is not a function
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Hello, I tried to build using `vercel build` 20 minutes ago using `vercel@latest` installed with `npm install -g vercel@latest` but I get this error : `Error: (0 , import_build_utils13.getInstalledPackageVersion) is not a function`. My GitHub Actions builds keep failing because they encounter this error at the end. How can I fix it?

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: [static-build] Don't rely on `hugo` binary existing in build-container (#11455) * Makes `hugo` framework preset work when Node.js v20.x is selected in Project Settings. * Stores the downloaded `hugo` binary in the `.vercel/cache` directory, so that it does not need to be re-downloaded upon every deployment. * Makes `vc build` work when run locally for Hugo projects - tested on macOS arm64.

COMMIT.MESSAGE: [build-utils] Trigger release of `@vercel/build-utils` PR #11305 didn't include this package as part of its changeset, so there was no new release even though it is exporting a new function. Adding this changeset so that the package is properly published. Closes #11464.

[build-utils] Trigger release of `@vercel/build-utils` (#11465) PR #11305 didn't include this package as part of its changeset, so there was no new release even though it is exporting a new function. Adding this changeset so that the package is properly published. Closes #11464.
